paper.title: FACTORS ASSOCIATED WITH LOW-BIRTH-WEIGHT IN AN INNER-CITY POPULATION - THE ROLE OF FINANCIAL PROBLEMS
paper.abstract: A case-control study of low birthweight among residents of high risk areas of Alameda County was conducted in 1983. The relation of 13 variables to low birthweight was assessed using a multiple logistic regression analysis. A six-fold increase in the risk of low birthweight was found in association with financial problems during the current pregnancy, controlling for differences in race, certain poor health habits, complications of pregnancy, and several other factors between cases and controls.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究低出生体重与财务问题之间的关系，属于公共卫生领域，并未涉及衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等金融研究领域。
